Currently PDT doesn't support official PHP manuals in the Standard *.chm format, even though this would be easy to realize:

In Windows OS, *.chm support is built into Internet Explorer, which happens to be used in Eclipse as the internal browser.

As *.chm files need to be opened using a special handler, in the "Edit PHP Manual site" dialog, we would need to enter something like "mk:@MSITStore:C:\php_manual_de.chm::/de" (without quotes) as URL and "html" as file extension.

While we can enter any "http://" or "file:" resource to be used for the PHP Manual, "mk:" is not allowed and throws an error. It is in fact possible to tweak the "org.eclipse.php.ui.prefs", but still the "mk:" handler is not started.

When an Internal Browser window (with address bar) is manually opened, I can enter e.g. "mk:@MSITStore:C:\php_manual_de.chm::/de/function.is-array.html" to get my PHP manual page. So generally it does work, and the fact that it doesn't in PDT should be easily resolved:

1. We would at least need to allow users to manually enter a "mk:" resource in the "Edit PHP Manual site" dialog and to allow such a resource to be opened from the PHP function list.
2. We'd better ensure that either the internal browser or the external Internet Explorer is launched (and not Firefox) when opening such a "mk:" resource.
3. For convenience, the "Edit PHP Manual site" dialog could be improved: users would choose from radio buttons (see also #141305) if they want to open a url, a local directory (with HTML files) or a local *.chm file.

Please remember i18n.
NewPHPManualSiteDialog still has "::/en".
